{{Infobox football biography | name = Shikabala | image = | caption = | fullname = Mahmoud Abdel Razek Fadlallah
{{lang|ar|ÙØ­ÙÙØ¯ Ø¹Ø¨Ø¯ Ø§ÙØ±Ø§Ø²Ù ÙØ¶Ù Ø§ÙÙÙ "Ø´ÙÙØ§Ø¨Ø§ÙØ§"â}} | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1986|3|5|df=y}} | birth_place = [[Aswan]], [[Egypt]] | height = {{height|m=1.83}} | currentclub = [[Zamalek SC|Zamalek]] | clubnumber = 10 | position = [[Attacking midfielder]] | youthyears1 = 1996-2002 | youthclubs1 = [[Zamalek SC|Zamalek]] | years1 = 2002â2004 | clubs1 = [[Zamalek SC|Zamalek]] | caps1 = 22 | goals1 = 1 | years2 = 2004â2006 | clubs2 = [[PAOK F.C.|PAOK]] | caps2 = 23 | goals2 = 4 | years3 = 2006â2011 | clubs3 = [[Zamalek SC|Zamalek]] | caps3 = 151 | goals3 = 53 | nationalyears1 = 2005â | nationalteam1 = [[Egypt national football team|Egypt]] | nationalcaps1 = 12 | nationalgoals1 = 1 | pcupdate = 07 May 2010 (UTC) | ntupdate = 06 January 2010 (UTC) }} '''Mahmoud Abdel Razek Fadlallah''' ({{lang-arz|1=ÙØ­ÙÙØ¯ Ø¹Ø¨Ø¯ Ø§ÙØ±Ø§Ø²Ù ÙØ¶Ù Ø§ÙÙÙ "Ø´ÙÙØ§Ø¨Ø§ÙØ§"â}}   {{IPA-arz|mÃ¦Ä§ËmuËd ÊÃ¦bdelËÉ¾Ã¦ËzeÊ, -eÉ¾ËÉ¾Ã¦Ë- fÉdËlÉllÉ|IPA}}; born 5 March 1986), commonly known as '''Shikabala''' ({{IPA-arz|ÊikÃ¦ËbÃ¦ËlÃ¦, ÊikÉËbÉËlÉ|IPA}}) is an [[Egyptians|Egyptian]] [[Association football|footballer]] who currently plays for [[Egyptian Premier League]] club [[Zamalek SC]],[http://www.footmercato.net/Mahmoud-Abdel-Razak-6430_j.html Shikabala] where he started his football career. He has previously played for [[PAOK F.C.|PAOK]] of [[Thessaloniki]]. ==Career== Shikabala, who was born in [[Aswan]], [[Egypt]], plays a free role, usually in the upper midfield, either as a [[playmaker]], a [[Midfielder#Winger|winger]], or an attacking midfielder . He had a short spell in the [[Greek league]] with [[PAOK F.C.|PAOK]], however he had to return to Egypt to attend to [[Military service (Egypt)|military duties]], so he chose to regather with his previous youth club Zamalek . Shikabala was the subject of a dispute between PAOK and Zamalek, when he had to move to his youth club Zamalek in January 2007, while still officially belonging to PAOK. [[FIFA]] ruled that the move was illegal and suspended him from domestic competition for 6 months and also fined him 990,000 euros,[http://news.xinhuanet.com/english/2007-12/17/content_7268690.htm FIFA suspends Egyptian Shikabala for six months], Xinhua News Agency a decision that the [[Court of Arbitration for Sport]] upheld.[http://www.dailystaregypt.com/article.aspx?ArticleID=17384 Shikabala Set For Comeback], Daily News Egypt The ban ended on 26 October 2008[http://www.filgoal.com/English/News.asp?NewsID=48297 FIFA shows no leniency over Shikabalaâs suspension], FilGoal.com and he made his return in an under 20 game against [[Haras El Hodood]] the following day.[http://www.dailystaregypt.com/article.aspx?ArticleID=17411 Shikabala Inspires Zamalek Youth], Daily News Egypt He was due to make his first senior appearance on 7 November 2008 against [[Al-Mokawloon Al-Arab]][http://www.mtnfootball.com/live/content.php?Item_ID=17084 Crucial League Match For Zamalek], MTN Football In May 2008, Shikabala was included in the squad to represent Egypt in its qualification matches for the [[2010 FIFA World Cup]], At the 2nd of December 2010 Shikabala had scored his first hatrick ever with Zamalek, where all 3 goals have been scored with free kicks. He said after the match that he is living the best moments in his life with Zamalek this season where the time is first in the league and with the highest score average level since 1982 which Zamalek have it's record too. On December 31 of 2010, he announced his retirement from international football due to racist taunts from rival fans during a league match.[http://www.usatoday.com/sports/soccer/2010-12-31-1686152582_x.htm Shikabala ends Egypt career over racist taunts], USA Today Two days later, Shikabala backtracked on his decision to quit the [[Egypt national football team|national team]]. ==Honors== ===With Egypt=== *[[2010 Africa Cup of Nations]] *[[World Cup 2007 military]] *[[The best player in the international championship of the Olympic team in Qatar]] ===With Zamalek=== *[[Egyptian Premier League]] (2002â03) *Egyptian Premier League (2003-04) *Arab Championship (2003) *[[Egyptian Soccer Cup|Egyptian Cup]] (2008) *Egyptian Super Cup (2002) *African Super Cup (2002) *African Champions League (2002) *Saudi-Egyptian Super Cup (2003) ==Individual== *Egyptian's League Top Scorer (2010-11) == References == {{reflist}} == External links== *{{nfteams|23672}} *[http://www.socceregypt.com/socceregypt/socceregypt.php/2006/05/04/mahmoud_fadlalla_shikabala_fc_paoc_greec Egyptian Players Abroad: Mahmoud Fadlalla Shikaala - FC PAOK (Greece)], SoccerEgypt.com *[http://www.calcionews24.com/shikabala-dal-cairo-al-napoli-scheda-e-video.html Mahmoud Fadlalla Shikabala profile and video], CalcioNews24.com {{El Zamalek squad}} {{Egypt Squad 2010 Africa Cup of Nations}} {{Persondata | NAME = | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = | DATE OF BIRTH = 5 March 1986 | PLACE OF BIRTH = [[Aswan]], [[Egypt]] | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} [[Category:1986 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Egyptian footballers]] [[Category:Egypt international footballers]] [[Category:People from Aswan]] [[Category:2010 Africa Cup of Nations players]] [[Category:Zamalek players]] [[Category:PAOK F.C. players]] [[ar:Ø´ÙÙØ§Ø¨Ø§ÙØ§]] [[de:Mahmoud Abdelrazek]] [[fr:Mahmoud Abdelrazek]] [[nl:Shikabala]]
